result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrienne D Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adrienne D Jones appeared by video.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms appeared by video for Adrienne D Jones.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material from the State. Defense requested date for Plea hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Plea hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 11:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Adrienne D Jones in court, appear in person with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Detective S. Osmanski.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adrienne D Jones in court, appear by video with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness was not present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adrienne D Jones in court by video.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Adrienne D Jones in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Adrienne D Jones in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adrienne D Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
